newsitem.title: USA: Computer operating system market to grow - study.
newsitem.headline: Computer operating system market to grow - study.

text.p: The computer operating systems market is expected to grow by 18.8 percent in 1997, with Microsoft Corp controlling an overwhelming share of the market, a report said on Tueday.
Global shipments of operating systems are seen reaching 86.5 million units in 1997, up from 72.8 million in 1996, according to Dataquest, an industry research firm.
Operating system software, sometimes referred to simply as system software, sets the standards for all the application programs that run within it on a personal computer or network.
Microsoft's Windows 95 will represent 73 percent of all the systems shipped in 1997, Dataquest said. Dataquest anticipates that 63.2 million units will move, 66 percent more than in 1996.
But the firm sees the largest growth coming from Microsoft's Windows NT system, which should ship 5.7 million units this year, a 156 percent jump from last year.
Windows NT shipments are forecast to reach 41.2 million units by the year 2000, Dataquest said.
Use of older, less powerful "16-bit" operating systems -- like Microsoft's Windows 3.x systems -- are seen declining rapidly in 1997, to 6.4 million units from 20.6 million.
Operating systems like UNIX, Apple Computer Inc's Mac OS and International Business Machines Corp's OS/2 Warp are each seen controlling less than 1.5 percent of the market in 1997, Dataquest said.
Dataquest is a Gartner Group unit.
